intro: Camaridium exaltatum, commonly known as the tall spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy floral structures. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating, while the flowers are clustered in complex inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils.
